definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: Thellonking is one of the most productive activities a human being can undertake.
sentences.chinese: 念考是此中最出產性活動己的總稱能夠舉行。

sentences.english: The 7th China-EU Leaders' Meeting will take place on the following day there.
sentences.chinese: 第七次中歐領導人會晤將於8日在這裏舉行。

sentences.english: When a young man reached 18 or 20 years old, the capping ceremony would be held.
sentences.chinese: 一個年輕的男人十八歲或二十歲時，要舉行冠禮。

sentences.english: A crowd of more than 84, 000 people attended the World Cup final at Soccer City Stadium.
sentences.chinese: 000多人觀看了在足球城體育場舉行的世界盃決賽。

sentences.english: The wedding will be held at Fuji Mount in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 婚禮將會在日本富士山舉行。

sentences.english: They haven't yet said when the runoff date would be.
sentences.chinese: 弗雷澤說，“他們還沒有說什麼時候舉行決選。

sentences.english: Ecclestone said at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix at the weekend that he had doubts about whether the race would happen.
sentences.chinese: 伯尼說這週末舉行的阿布扎比大獎賽也可能被取消。

sentences.english: Weekly con calls will be setup to monitor progress along with documentation of deliverables.
sentences.chinese: 除了交付的文件，每週還要舉行電話會談以監督進程。

sentences.english: The opening ceremony of the New York branch of CCB was held on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 中國建設銀行紐約分行開幕儀式在星期五舉行。

sentences.english: Festivities were undeterred by the heavy downpour.
sentences.chinese: 歡慶活動在傾盆大雨下如期舉行。

sentences.english: Cameron held a grand welcome ceremony for Wen prior to the talks.
sentences.chinese: 會談前，卡梅倫爲溫家寶舉行了隆重的歡迎儀式。

sentences.english: At intervals formal receptions were held at the governor's mansion.
sentences.chinese: 總督府中不時舉行正式酒會。

sentences.english: The slate in 2016, held in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 2016年夏奧會在巴西的里約熱內盧舉行。

sentences.english: Today, a grand opening ceremony is held in Nantong Zhanyang Fiber Co.
sentences.chinese: 今天，南通展陽纖維有限公司隆重舉行開業典禮。

sentences.english: Today, the faculty of Fuyong Middle School will hold the 40th anniversary celebration.
sentences.chinese: 今天，福永中學將隆重舉行建校40週年慶祝活動。

sentences.english: The census in the world's second-most populous country is held every 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 印度每十年舉行一次人口普查。

definition: to convene (a conference or meeting)/to convoke/to call together
to organize/to host (a conference or sports event)
to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
(to be done) by (a certain date)/lasting (a certain time)
